metadata.title: CVE-2021-3669 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel. Measuring usage of the shared memorydoes not scale with large shared memory segment counts which could lead toresource exhaustion and DoS.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3669` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-208-generic - 4.15.0-208.220
linux-image-4.15.0-208-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-208.220
linux-image-4.15.0-208-lowlatency - 4.15.0-208.220
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-208-generic - 4.15.0-208.220
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-208-lowlatency - 4.15.0-208.220
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-146-generic - 5.4.0-146.163~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-146-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-146.163~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-146-lowlatency - 5.4.0-146.163~18.04.1

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-146-lowlatency - 5.4.0-146.163~18.04.1
No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-208.220').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-146.163~18.04.1').
